content.prompt: Which of the following conclusions related to the migration trend depicted in the graph between 1899 and 1924 is most logical?

choices.label: The Great Migration led to the transfer of Southern African American cultures to Northern cities and states.
Afro-Caribbean immigration to the United States led to a greater diversity of religious and linguistic cultures in Black communities.
The increase in Afro-Caribbean immigrants resulted in a reduction of racial tensions across Northern and Southern states.
The heightened demand for urban labor resulted in the immigration of many African Americans from Southern to Northern states.

skill.text: 2.D: Describe and draw conclusions from patterns, trends, and limitations in data, making connections to relevant course content.
